thread.title: Thursday’s area sports briefs (Oct. 22)

author: From staff reports
title: Thursday’s area sports briefs (Oct. 22)
text:
Thursday’s area sports briefs (Oct. 22) 
From staff reports 
The Green Sea Floyds cross country is set for the Class AA/A state meet. 
The hard part is just the wait. 
The Trojans boys and girls took first place in the Region VIII-A meet Thursday and do not have to participate in the Lower State tournament as Green Sea Floyds gets an automatic spot in the Class AA/A meet in Columbia on Nov. 7. 
“It’s good news and bad news,” Green Sea Floyds coach Phyllis Elvington said of the automatic State title berth. “The good news is that we don’t have to travel to Columbia two Saturdays in a row; it’s real expensive and time consuming. But the bad part is that we don’t compete for two weeks.” 
The Trojans’ Alyssa Slobodiak (22:08) finished first as she had a season-best time to lead the Green Sea Floyds girls, which had eight runners finish in the top 10. Meanwhile, Madison Pope (Third, 23:39), Abby Marlowe (Fourth, 23:40) and Katya Howell (24:07) were each named to the All-Region team, representing the Trojans. 
On the boys’ side, Alfredo Vasquez (18:48) paced Green Sea Floyds with a first place finish, while Bryce Ford (second, 19:01), Steele Willoughby (third, 19:21) and Dawson Floyd (fifth, 20:26) were named All-Region runners. 
“I’m really proud our boys and girls were champs,” Elvington said. “Eight in the top 10 on the girls side and seven in the top 10 for the boys; not bad. I was pleased with how we placed in the region.” 
Meanwhile, Elvington said the Trojans will have to just go even harder during practice with the extended time off. 
“It’s kind of disheartening because we’re peaking; we had our top 11 boys finish with personal best times and the girls have been doing really well, too,” Elvington said. “We just have to run and practice real hard from now until then.” 
The Green Sea Floyds girls are 25-11 overall this year, while the boys stand at 20-17. Elvington wants to see a strong showing in Columbia. 
“We need to focus,” she said. “We want to finish well and have some all-state runners.” 
Girls 
Team scores: Green Sea Floyds 23, Carvers Bay 45, Latta inc. 
Top 10: 1. Alyssa Slobodiak (GSF) 22:08; 2. Meagan Dennis (CB) 23:33; 3. Madison Pope (CB) 23:39; 4. Abby Marlowe (GSF) 23:40; 5. Katya Howell (GSF) 24:07; 6. JoAna Jimes (GSF) 25:08; 7. America Sandoval (GSF) 25:47; 8. Rebecca Williamson (GSF) 27:40; 9. Tess Graham (GSF) 28:23; 10. Morgan Marlowe (GSF) 29:05. 
Boys 
Team scores: Green Sea Floyds 17, Carvers Bay 52, Latta 94 
Top 10: 1. Alfredo Vasquez (GSF) 18:48; 2. Bryce Ford (GSF) 19:01; 3. Steele Willoughby (GSF) 19:21; 4. Roberto Vasquez (CB) 20:19; 5. Dawson Floyd (GSF) 20:26; 6. Tyler Graham (GSF) 20:30; 7. Cole Powell (GSF) 20:40; 8. David Lopez (GSF) 20:52; 9. Christian Williams (CB) 21:16; 10. James Milton (CB) 21:21. Related content
